function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of accurate risk maps","category":"Data Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate data collection and review risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate quantification of endogenous parameters like creatinine and urea could lead to incorrect assessments of water quality and potential health risks.","category":"Inaccurate or Incomplete Data","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited descriptive material based on quantitative methods","category":"Inaccurate or Incomplete Data","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data collected from a specific group may not be representative of the overall population of kuwait, leading to biased conclusions.","category":"Data Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reporting biases and incomplete coverage of testing approaches","category":"Inaccurate or Incomplete Data","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to validate the integrity of the encrypted file","category":"Data Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collection and analysis of publicly available twitter feeds may contain personal or sensitive information related to loneliness and covid-19.","category":"Privacy risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Privacy concerns among building occupants due to the continuous collection of personal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Anonymized mobility data may compromise individual privacy and data security.","category":"Privacy risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health inequities in data inclusivity.","category":"Limited Accessibility and Data Equity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous assembly of data from various sources","category":"Data Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of data standardization","category":"Reliability and Quality of Data","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data availability and reliability challenges related to covid-19 impact","category":"Reliability and Quality of Data","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on preprints for public-health decisions without robust
